content.raw:
Yup, definetly duplicate the entries in command options and man pages is a pain to maintain, specially if they are changing frequently. I'm only consider the option of going with duplication and not making the automation since I believe we are not going to have many updates on them.

Changing stderr to stdout when calling ```-h``` is a good step, IMHO.

More problem should represent the restrictions to writting code which are not controlled (specially by the compiler), in this case:

1. All binaries should implement a ```-h``` command
1. The ```-h``` command should work during the compilation phase.

The auto generation via ```gz_install_executable``` seems a bit obscure to me, but probably it is not a big deal, and indeed, it will force to write ```-h``` commands ... or not, and if someone forgot about writting the ```-h``` the make_ronn probably won't fail. This is one of my fears, end up with bad content in manpages without a failure.

We can try it, if it turns into a pain, we can go back and look for the manual solution.
